notesStmt.note: Marginal glosses in a fourteenth-century cursive hand

Alfonso X of Castile, Fuero de Burgos. European MS 245, Philadelphia Free Library, microfiche facsimile and commentary, edited by Ivy A. Corfis, Spanish Legal Texts 1 (Madison: The Hispanic Seminary of Medieval Studies, 1987)

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a copy of the Fuero Real, the legal code promulgated by Alfonso X during his reign in the second half of the thirteenth century. Written in northern Spain during his reign, the text is written in a round textualis script and decorated throughout with colored initials. The four book divisions are marked with large colored initials, and a table of contents at the beginning of the volume lists the titles within each book. A fourteenth-century reader added marginal glosses in cursive script.

msItem.title: Fuero real (Royal municipal code)
msItem.author: Alfonso X, King of Castile and Leon, 1221-1284

msItem.title: Title lists for Books I-IV
msItem.incipit: Estos son los titulos del libro primero... [fol. 2r]
msItem.explicit: XXV Titulo del pecio de los navios [fol. 3v]

msItem.title: Fuero Real, Book I, "Este es el libro de los fueros que dio el rey don alffonsso a la noble cibdat de burgos que es cabeca de castiella"
msItem.incipit: En el nombre de dios. Amen. Por que los coraçones de los omnes son departidos... [fol. 4r]
msItem.explicit: ... demandar a aq[ue]l q[ue] la enageno o aq[ue]l q[ue] la recibio. [fol. 18r]

msItem.title: Fuero Real, Book II
msItem.explicit: ... denostare o abiltare a aquel que se alça de so myzio aya esta pena sobre dicha. [fol. 35v]

msItem.title: Fuero Real, Book III
msItem.incipit: Establecemos [y] mandamos q[ue] todos los casamyentos ... [fol. 36r]
msItem.explicit: ... sea apoderado del cuerpo del debdor. assi cuemo mandala ley. [fol. 65v]

msItem.title: Fuero Real, Book IV
msItem.incipit: Ningun [ch]r[ist]iano no[n] sea osado de tornarse iudio, nin moro ... [fol. 66r]
msItem.explicit: ...la muerte qua q[ua]nto tomare enterguelo a aq[ue]l a q[ui] lo ma[n]do… [fol. 92v]

supportDesc.extent: ii+92+ii; 247 x 178 mm bound to 259 x 188 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.signatures: Vertical catchwords in ink, lower right last verso

layoutDesc.layout: One column of twenty-six lines, hard point ruling, prickings in inner and outer margins visible, first line written above top line: written area: 173 x 126 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Four large decorated initials, flourished initials in red, blue, and green ink throughout; some marginal notation throughout

binding.p: Eighteenth-century, Spanish, mottled calf over pasteboards, marbled endpapers; gold tooled panels on spine, inscribed FUERO DE BURGOS; Phillipps label, no. 6736, on spine

history.provenance: Frederick North, Earl of Guilford (1766-1827); Sir Thomas Phillipps (1792-1872), his no. 6736; his sale London, Sotheby's, November 24, 1966, lot. no. 51; H. P. Krauss (book dealer); The Free Library of Philadelphia, purchased 1968 with Gratz Fund
